piglin8.g: That fancy gold armor means nothing to me! You're still an outsider! Prepare for a beatdown, fancy-pants!
piglin8.a: An outsider! Who do you think you are, walking around here? I'm going to show you what we do to your kind in the Nether!
piglin7.g: I can't believe he lied! He told me he's from the Nether, but in reality, he's from the overworld! And now, to make matters worse, my little boy ran off to stab him with a knife!
piglin7.a1: "Do you know where I could get gold armor?"
piglin7.1: There is that one piglin that may be of help to you. The others don't like him, so he stays away. I think he sometimes is at Netheran's place.
piglin6.g: Welcome to the Nether! If you've already met the other piglins, ignore them! Those guys only talk with people in full gold armor and they kicked me out because I'm friendly to everyone!
piglin6.g2: Thank you again for the hoglin meat!
piglin6.a1: Trade Hoglin Meat for three pieces of Golden Armor
piglin6.1: Thanks! I haven't had some good hoglin meat in a while. Those other piglins won't let me go near them or the hoglins. Here, you can have this golden armor!
iron_golem.1: Only one of us walks away!
hint.dive: » It looks like you can dive here!
hint.grave: » It looks like you could open this grave!
hint.graves: » It looks like you could open these graves!
hint.mine: » It looks like you could break these blocks!
hint.equipment: » It looks like you need special equipment, like a special piece of armor, to pass this!
hint.equipment2: » It looks like this helmet still needs to be enchanted!
hint.cant: » It looks like you can't break this yourself, but perhaps someone within the town walls is able to?
hint.blocks: » It looks like you could place blocks here!
hint.ascension_key: » It looks like this gate is locked, and a normal key probably won't suffice. Who could be responsible for guarding a fitting key?
hint.mourner: » At the sight of the mask, the mourner fainted.
hint.bee: » It looks like the beehive can be knocked down!
hint.board: » You can click the board to play!
hint.kid: » The disease is dangerous! Is the wait worth the deaths it may cost? If you really need bricks, you should probably look for another type of block instead.
hint.checkpoint: » An Ender Anchor has been activated. If you fall into the void, you will be respawned at the most recently activated Ender Anchor!
task.3: Find the origin of the fire!
multiplayer.disconnect.flying: Kicked for flying/standing on a character
options.languageWarning: Language translations may not be 1±±%% accurate
lore.rletter.name: ?roberto_full
lore.newspaper.6.1: Ancient creatures come back to life,
lore.newspaper.6.2: seen in lake, ruins and forest!
lore.newspaper.8.2: gold each. Find us in the swamp!
lore.mletter.4: find any I'll send someone to %s
lore.needle.1: Can be used to lockpick huge doors!
lore.key.1: You can use this to access
tip1: Tip: Click a character's head with an empty hand to interact with them!
tip2: Tip: Steal and trade items so that you will be strong enough to beat the boss!
tip3: Tip: By using Potion of Times, you can travel back in time by one hour!
tip4: Tip: A beacon shows where you need to go!
tip6: Tip: Sometimes you just need to scam a character!
tip7: Tip: By using Potion of Progressions, you can travel forwards in time by one hour! This way, you can skip wait times.
tip8: Tip: By using Potion of Storms, you can cause a storm. This affects the world in several ways.
tip9: Tip: Sometimes you can do trades several times at once. For example, you can click the [x2] button behind the trade to do it twice. The normal trade still works as well.
tip10: Tip: Remember to follow the beacon!
tip11: Tip: All tales (other than the tutorial) take place in the same world. Many of the things you learn will be useful more than once!
tip12: Tip: Don't be disappointed if you can't figure this out the first time! Use the time to explore and discover things. Most people can eventually complete this on the second or third try.
tip13: Tip: There are a lot of side quests and other things that may distract you! Stay focused on your goal!
tip14: Tip: Animals drop useful items when killed!
tip15: Tip: Some items, like a key, are items that characters probably won't give to you willingly. You can, however, steal from them while they are asleep! You should see if anyone in the town is asleep in the mornings!
tip16: Tip: You lost the first time, but don't worry! This is perfectly normal, and now you know the world at least a bit. This time, try to focus on the main quest as much as you can.
tip17: Tip: Battling enemies rewards you with items that help you against the final boss!
tip18: Tip: Some characters may have new trades now!
tip19: Tip: In fights, always try to keep your stamina as high as possible! This allows you to regenerate, which is very important!
tip20: Tip: Fight as many enemies as you can before the final boss! All enemies drop valuable loot, like healing items and weapons.
tip21: Tip: Press %s to see a map of the world!
tip22: Tip: Don't forget that you can see a map by pressing %s!
tip23: Tip: This is a tutorial for the Throwable Attack. It is definitely worth trying!
tip24: Tip: Make sure you have Voice/Speech and Custom Music enabled in the settings!
tip25: Tip: Trading with the Wandering Trader is never necessary, though occasionally helpful. He simply provides alternative ways to get certain items!
tip26: Tip: Don't forget to block by right-clicking when the Iron Nuggets turn into Iron Ingots!
tip27: Tip: Don't forget to look around in your own house! It may contain important hints.
tip28: Tip: Perhaps traveling back in time could be useful now.
tip29: Tip: Perhaps traveling forward in time could be useful now.
tip30: Tip: Don't forget about the beacon!
tip31: Tip: The bosses keep getting stronger, so once you've figured everything out, make sure to also gather some equipment!
tip32: Tip: In the 'Options' section, you can find several other useful functions. Use Armor and Passive Items to see more information about additional combat items. Use Companions to see which tamed animals will help you in combat. Use Turn Frequencies and Elemental Types for more information about enemies!
tip33: Tip: Companions are animals you have tamed in the world. Your strongest companion will help you during combat.
tip34: Tip: Here you can see the turn frequency of all participants of a fight. Participants with a higher frequency get more turns. You can increase your own turn frequency with potions!
tip35: Tip: Here you can see a list of effects enemies are strong (S) and weak (W) against. For example, a Fire Staff will do considerably more damage against an enemy who is weak against fire than to an enemy who isn't. Enemies that are strong against fire will take very little damage from it and won't be set on fire. This affects all of the damage of all weapons that also apply an effect.
tip36: Tip: Items like Speed Potions can be used in combat to attack more often!
tip37: Tip: Most staffs are elemental weapons. Their name lists the elemental effect they apply. Check 'Elemental Types' in 'Options' to see what elements each enemy is immune or weak against.
tip38: Tip: Here you can see a list of effects that currently influence you.
tip39: Tip: Using 'Break Free' you can escape from physical barriers placed on your character. Read the description in your inventory for more information!
tip40: Tip: You can zoom in a fight by sneaking!
tip41: Tip: You won because one of your pawns reached the other side or because the Mayor does not have any available valid moves.
tip42: Tip: The piglins won't properly talk to you unless you wear full golden armor!
tip43: Tip: You lost because one of the Mayor's pawns reached your side.
tip44: Tip: You lost because you do not have any available valid moves.
tip45: Tip: While you're in another dimension, time doesn't pass in the overworld!
tip46: Tip: Maximum chat width (default) in Chat Settings is recommended.
tip47: Tip: During combat, you can flee using 'Options'.
tip48: Tip: The Poison Amulet only works during combat.
tip49: Tip: You are attacking an enemy with an effect they are immune against. Make sure to check 'Elemental Types' in 'Options' to choose the best weapon.
tip50: Tip: Put items that you may not need anymore into Ender Chests, to make sure they can't be lost.
tip51: Tip: Time passes faster while you are asleep.
tip52: Tip: Remember that the beacon shows where you need to go! Checking out what is there should always be the first thing you do!
tip53: Tip: Often a character can be found in the town that provides you with important information about the Tale. Make sure you don't miss it!
tip54: Tip: Regret your choice? Check out the ruins near the brewery.
tip55: Tip: Don't forget you can interact with characters, only by right-clicking them with an empty hand.
tip56: Tip: These stories may contain more than just a grain of truth. Perhaps they aren't relevant to the current Tale, but surely they still are worth investigating.
tip57: Tip: Maybe you could disguise yourself as a dog?
tip58: Tip: You need to find four. There's one in the town, one at the observatory and two in the forest.
tip59: Tip: There's a tower in the town.

tutorial.1.d: 为此，你需要尽可能多地搜寻线索。
tutorial.1.e: 例如能和谁进行交易，谁身上有好东西，

tutorial.2.a: 翻箱子是获取物资的最快方式。
tutorial.2.b: 不过，如果你想偷取NPC的私人物品
tutorial.2.c: 最好等到他们睡着再动手。
tutorial.3.a: 整张地图严格基于时间运行。
tutorial.3.b: 大多数事件，例如角色何时起床，

tutorial.3.d: 侧边栏显示了当前的游戏内时间。
tutorial.4.a: 推进故事的过程中，你或许会发现

credits.title: Tales of Glarthford
lobby.quest.locked.2: 完成 故事%s 以解锁
lobby.hexapawn.msg.2: 右击棋盘以开始小游戏。你将作为白方行棋！
lobby.hexapawn.msg.3: 右击一个棋子来选中它，随后右击其正前方的空位即可将其移动。
lobby.hexapawn.msg.4: 如果棋子的对角线上有敌方棋子，你可以选择斜向移动并吃掉敌方棋子。
lobby.hexapawn.msg.5: 当你有一枚棋子成功到达棋盘另一侧，或者你的对手无法再移动它的棋子，则判定你获胜。
lobby.combat.msg.8: 修改战斗的难度以及敌人的数量。同时也会调整武器和盔甲的强度。和平模式下，战斗场景都将被跳过。
lobby.spectating: 你将以旁观者身份参与游戏！
lobby.credits.info: 按住 %s 以停止观看开发团队！
lobby.selection.title: 角色选择
lobby.selection.error: 同一时间只能有一个人进行角色选择！
lobby.selection.msg.2: 在这里你可以自定义自己在战斗场景和过场动画的角色。
lobby.selection.msg.3: 通过右击箭头调整角色设计。改变性别时，角色的声线也将随之改变。
lobby.selection.msg.4: 使用最右侧的选项可以为你保存最多三种角色预设并随时读取。
jukebox.name: Jukebox
jukebox.creator: by %s
fact.1: There is a hidden 25-page diary somewhere in the map!
fact.2: The Scribbling Enderman's book is actually readable if you read it backwards.
fact.3: The voice actor for the Witch character is actually one of the male creators making a funny voice.
fact.4: Crows seem to have taken over Glarthford. No scarecrow can stop them now.
fact.5: Drinking a time potion while looking at the windmill looks quite amusing.
fact.6: The ending of the End Disease changes depending on the number of survivors.
fact.7: Beehives can be collected by punching them.
fact.8: The Mourner is the most popular character among the developers! In an average call, her voice line is repeated more than 5 times!
fact.9: Looking up the elemental types of enemies can be a huge advantage in battles!
fact.10: Attacks are explained in the main menu during fights. Just hover over the item for a full explanation.
fact.11: Enemies drop valuable loot items, which are helpful for beating the bosses.
fact.12: Time only passes in the overworld.
fact.13: 试试看在大厅中对着电脑滚动鼠标滚轮或右键点击。

book.tr.title: Diary
book.tr.author: Thomas Rubycrust
book.tr.content.1:
Today, my nephew,
Prince Viktor
Thornheart, left on a
diplomatic mission
across the sea. It's
the Prince's first
mission of this sort.
He is expected to be
back in around a
month. My nephew is
thrilled that he is
finally old enough to
go on these missions!
book.tr.content.2:
Two months ago, my
nephew left Invaila,
our port town, with a
ship of the royal
fleet. He was expected
to be back a month
ago, but still, we
haven't heard
anything. King Percival
has now sent a letter
to Warthford, the
destination of Viktor.
book.tr.content.3:
I've never seen my
sister, Queen Helene,
so worried in my
entire life. Warthford
sent a reply, and
Viktor never arrived
there. Tomorrow,
Percival is sending
out all the 137
remaining ships of the
royal fleet to search
the entire ocean for
Viktor.
book.tr.content.4:
There still has been
no word of Viktor.
Many of the ships
have returned, and
none have seen any
sign of Viktor. The
King's advisors tell him
that Viktor’s ship must
have sunk, but I can
see he has not yet
given up hope.
book.tr.content.5:
Viktor left a year ago,
and the entire royal
fleet is back now. The
King gave up hope as
well, there will be a
funeral soon. After
hundreds of years,
this is where the
Thornheart family dies
out. Viktor was the
only heir to the
throne, except if...
book.tr.content.6:
Viktor's funeral was
today. Everyone was
confronted with the
harsh truth that the
death of Percival was
the ending of the
beloved Thornheart
dynasty. I do not know
what to do.
book.tr.content.7:
For many months now
the King's advisors,
like me, had to run the
country because of
his grief. There have
been rumors along
the smallfolk of him
being dead, but today
he finally granted
audiences again.
book.tr.content.8:
Today something
unbelievable
happened. Viktor
Thornheart entered
the throne room. I'm
suspicious, the Prince
seems a lot colder
than he used to be,
but the King believes
it's truly him.
book.tr.content.9:
The Prince looks
exactly like when he
left, still I'm left with
too many questions. If
it's truly the Prince,
has he been
brainwashed,
perhaps? He doesn't
behave like he used
to.
book.tr.content.10:
To honor Viktor's
return, a banquet was
held today. The King
toasted to his son's
return, while he held
his beer high up, and
the sun, from behind
the King, made it shine
in a yellow-green
color. Today, Viktor
smiled for the first
time since his return.
Maybe it really is him.
book.tr.content.11:
The King suddenly got
very sick. Old age, the
doctor says, but I
know he is wrong. The
king is old, but with his
perfect health, he is
supposed to have
many years left.
Poison. My suspicions
have been right. I'm
sure Viktor or
whoever he actually
is, poisoned the king.
book.tr.content.12:
The King died, a
funeral will be held at
the start of the next
month. Perhaps the
King wouldn't like it,
because he is blinded
from the truth, but it's
time to start the
secret plan. The
Viktor impersonator is
not the heir!
book.tr.content.13:
Only shortly after
Percival's funeral,
Viktor crowned himself
as 'Emperor of
Tharros,' claiming he
couldn't replace his
father, so he chose
another title. I've
considered leaving
the capital, Ankardia,
or even the whole
Kingdom, but I'm more
helpful here!
book.tr.content.14:
The Emperor is a
cruel ruler, so cruel
that I was able to
convince my sister
that he is not actually
her son. She left
Tharros to start a
resistance called
'Torn Earth' while I
try to destroy the
Emperor's plans from
the inside.
book.tr.content.15:
The Emperor seems to
trust me. He does not
know I'm Helene's
brother. He found out
about Torn Earth and
is now spreading news
about an organization
that is kidnapping
people - people that
are actually just
joining the resistance.
book.tr.content.16:
The Emperor is
planning to invade the
whole continent using
the old royal fleet.
"Sadly," we can't
afford it since there
does not seem to be
enough gold. Who
could be responsible?
book.tr.content.17:
Grimsbane - the
Emperor's true name,
as he has now
revealed to the High
Council, his "trusted"
advisors like me, is
getting crueler each
day. I need to
proceed with my plans
right now... I need to
find Percival's hidden
illegitimate son, Brian.
book.tr.content.18:
I'm on a mission to get
a loan so that
Grimsbane can afford
to conquer the
continent, but actually,
I'm looking for Brian.
Supposedly, he is in
Invaila, so that's
where I'll start my
search.
book.tr.content.19:
I found out where
Brian lived. He left to
find his "kidnapped"
sister, Katrina,
however. I assume she
left to join Torn
Earth, so I hope Brian
will be able to find TE
and join as well. I
need to end my
search here and
return to the capital.
book.tr.content.20a:
This is it. Grimsbane
has found a group of
TE members sneaking
in the sewers below
the palace placing
explosives. He
captured them and
executed them on the
spot, but not before
getting their names
and the position of
the TE hideout.
book.tr.content.20b:
Katrina and Brian
were in the sewers
with them. The
Thornhearts are
dead. At last, I'm
abandoning my post in
the palace, I need to
save my sister at
least!
book.tr.content.21:
I know the TE hideout
is on an island, and
that's where Helene
will be. When I arrived
in Invaila, the whole
city was burning,
however. I won't be
able to leave Tharros
with a boat. Grimsbane
sent out a ship full of
killers to the hideout
and then destroyed
the city.
book.tr.content.22:
Grimsbane is crazy. He
is destroying the
entire Kingdom. I
haven't returned to
the palace, but I’ve
still heard that the
mission to destroy TE
has been successful.
I'll go over the Sirdia
Mountains to start a
new life. There is
nothing left for me
here.
book.tr.content.23:
I've arrived in a small
city called Glarthford.
It is completely
surrounded by
mountains. I should be
safe here. I will tell
nobody of my past.
Grimsbane seems to be
fine with ruling over a
ruined Tharros so he
shouldn't be any
danger to me anymore.
book.tr.content.24:
I'm enjoying this
peaceful life in
Glarthford... My sister
and I should have
never left Rubycrust
Manor, we should've
never went to
Ankardia. But now
everyone I knew is
dead, my home also
destroyed, and the
kingdom I helped rule:
A ruin.
book.gary.author: Gary
book.gary.title: Diary
book.gary.1:
I suppose I shall log
my discoveries here in
this town apparently
called Glarthford. I
was drawn here due
to some odd chronal
occurrence. I am
unsure what is
happening, but I am
determined to figure it
out. For now, I think I
will hide out in this
hole.
book.gary.2:
Okay, so it is blatantly
obvious that there is
a time loop happening
here. It seems every
morning the entire
region reverts to the
state that it was the
previous day. I have
also located some
potions that seem to
only affect my flow of
time.
book.gary.3:
I think this loop is
more complicated than
I expected. It is winter
now, somehow. I am
unsure what has
happened or how this
occurred, this is
unlike other time loops
I have encountered.
Also of note, I think
someone else is aware
of these time loops.
book.gary.4:
There is for sure
someone else that is
aware of these loops,
and I think they might
also have control
over them. If they
don't have direct
control over the
loops, they do seem to
be at least correlated
to why the loops
change to different
scenarios
occasionally.
book.gary.5:
I was observing the
individual that seems
to dictate these loops,
and it seems that
there is a strange
portal to a realm
where time moves much
more quickly than
here. I am still not
sure if they are
aware of the time
loops, I suppose I may
know in time.
book.gary.6:
Okay, I think I am going
to try to determine if
this individual has
memory of previous
loops. I suppose I
could go out to the
same place every loop
and ask for some
outrageous thing, and
if they bring it to me
before I ask, they
know...
book.short.author: Opal Swine Ender
book.short.title: Short Stories
book.short.1.title: The Lost Gem
book.short.1:
There once was an
Enderman, who had
found a Sapphire.
Scared that it would
be stolen from him, he
went into the deepest
mine he could find and
hid it at the highest
location he could see.
Several days later a
waterfall appeared
and he never went
back. Is it still there?
book.short.2.title: The Hidden Home
book.short.2:
There once was a man
called Richy. He lived
behind the Blacksmith.
His friend Gerard
wanted to live close to
him, so he built his
house below Richy's. It
could only be entered
by clicking a button
near Richy's house.
Unfortunately, nobody
ever visited him. I
wonder why?
book.short.3.title: The Mighty Dragon
book.short.3:
Once upon a time, a
dragon lived. He would
peacefully fly across
the skies, and scare
off raiders. One day
somebody shot him.
They found that the
dragon's scales were
a useful powder. They
would do it again. The
dragon had to hide.
Raiders would come.
Was it worth it?

book.ose.author: Cedric Runewyck
book.ose.title: Reignford
book.ose.content.1:
King Grim IV of
Tharros, sitting atop
his throne, stares at
the scene before him.
His guards lie dead on
the ground, enclosing
the throne, and two
determined men
approach him, soon
followed by many
more. Thorn, the
leader of the
rebellion,
book.ose.content.2:
is clothed in dark
robes, showing a
stark contrast to his
shining emerald eyes,
and their most notable
fighter, Lethros, a
fierce man with short
black hair. The
Monarch realizes this
is where the Grim
Dynasty will end. Still,
he stands up and
approaches the men;
book.ose.content.3:
The final stand of his
regime. The rebels
are soaked with the
blood of the slain
guards, and the water
of the newly-built
sewers, which they
cleverly used to lead
their men into the
castle. A gaping hole
in the defenses of the
castle, he realizes.
They should have
been secured better.
book.ose.content.4:
However, that
realization comes far
too late. He was not
expecting a rebellion
back then, and why
should he have? After
all, the Grim dynasty
had brought a
long-lasting period of
prosperity to the
kingdom. Who could've
known Grim's reign
would be any
different?
book.ose.content.5:
Suddenly, the King
draws his sword and
unexpectedly leaps
forward with
remarkable speed,
attacking Thorn, and
causing a bleeding
injury. Thorn slumps
to the ground,
clutching his injured
side, a pained
expression visible on
his face. He turns to
Lethros, who has
book.ose.content.6:
now drawn his sword.
Then, the two
still-standing men
attack each other. A
crescendo of sword
clashes can be heard
through the throne
room, until, at last, the
battle slowly reaches
its conclusion. The
intensity of the
struggle, or perhaps
their honor, has led
to the remaining
book.ose.content.7:
rebels staying away
from the fighting for
now. The King starts
advancing, a final time,
and strikes with his
sword. To no avail; His
attack is quickly
blocked by the Rebel.
They are very close
now, and Lethros
starts retreating.
Again, the ruler
prepares to strike
once more.
book.ose.content.8:
Then, all of a sudden,
the black-haired man
twirls around the
King's blade in an
attempt to strike the
monarch’s side. The
attempt fails; The
rebel's blade meets
the royal one, and
they quickly become
locked. Without missing
a beat, Lethros uses
the opportunity and
promptly kicks his
book.ose.content.9:
opponent. Grim drops
to the ground, cursing
his attackers,
however, before he
can get up again,
Thorn, having
returned to the fight,
strikes him through
the heart. Thorn
breathes heavily, still
clutching his injured
side, holding his
blood-stained sword.
The battle has
book.ose.content.10:
been won. Grim is
spread on the ground
lifelessly, staring at
the ceiling with empty,
dead eyes. His crown
lies nearby, having
fallen down from his
head during the
scuffles. The inset
gemstones, four
sapphires and rubies,
still brightly reflect
light, as if nothing had
happened. The rebels
book.ose.content.11:
are standing around
the fallen body,
celebrating. One of
the intruders walks up
to the crown, picks it
up unceremoniously,
and puts it on Thorn’s
head. The Grim
Dynasty is over, and
at last a new era has
begun. Later, this will
be known as Year 0,
the year that marks
the start of a new
book.ose.content.12:
royal family, the reign
of Thorn’s lineage,
now dubbed
Thornheart, for the
final blow dealt to the
old ruler. A dynasty,
which leads Tharros
into a period of
peace, one that lasts
for centuries. But in
the end, peace can
never last forever...
